jobs.title: Customer Care Specialist
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Synergy Pet Group is a recognized leader in the pet industry, known for delivering innovative, high-quality products that enhance the lives of pets and their owners. With consistent growth and a strong market presence, we take pride in our commitment to customer satisfaction and making an impact that matters.

Position Overview

Are you a seasoned customer service professional with 3–5 years of experience and a passion for delivering outstanding support? We’re seeking a Customer Care Specialist to join our team and play a key role in ensuring customer satisfaction at every touchpoint. This full-time position is scheduled Monday through Friday, 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM Eastern Time.

As the first point of contact for our valued members, you will manage a steady volume of customer interactions through phone, email, and LiveChat. If you thrive in a fast-paced environment, enjoy problem-solving, and take pride in providing exceptional service, we’d love to hear from you.

Core Responsibilities

· Manage a minimum of 40 customer call, email, and chat tickets daily with accuracy, empathy, and efficiency.

· Own the customer experience end-to-end by proactively resolving issues and following up to ensure satisfaction.

· Process account updates and changes accurately within 24 hours.

· De-escalate and manage complex customer concerns with professionalism and a solutions-first approach.

· Maintain detailed records of every customer interaction in our CRM system.

· Identify emerging issues and escalate them appropriately to ensure timely resolutions.

· Prioritize and follow up on time-sensitive or urgent customer needs.

· Provide personalized support by actively listening and tailoring solutions.

· Gather and encourage customer feedback to inform continuous improvement.

· Collaborate closely with teammates to share insights and best practices.

· Participate in training, team meetings, and development opportunities to stay sharp and informed.

Required Qualifications

· 3–5 years of professional customer service experience in a fast-paced environment (call center, customer success, or support center preferred).

· Must obtain a Property & Casualty insurance license within the first 3–6 months of employment; employment and compensation are contingent upon licensure.

· Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

· Highly organized with superior attention to detail and accuracy.

· Demonstrated ability to manage multiple tasks and shifting priorities with composure.

· Goal-oriented and self-motivated with a strong sense of ownership and initiative.

· Comfortable working under pressure while maintaining exceptional service quality.

· Receptive to feedback and committed to continuous learning and growth.

· Dependable and punctual, with a consistent and reliable work schedule.

· Strong interpersonal skills, with a commitment to respect, teamwork, and collaboration.

Preferred Attributes

· A warm, friendly, and customer-first attitude.

· Pet lover – enthusiasm for animals is a big plus!

· Experience in pet insurance, veterinary services, or a related industry is a bonus.

Why Join Us?

Join Our Pack

At Synergy Pet Group, we believe that strong relationships are our recipe for success. A happy and successful team creates a fun and prosperous environment where everyone can thrive!

Work with a team of individuals encouraging one another every day, knowing that each person’s success is a company-wide success. If you like to innovate, share ideas, and see your impact on the Synergy’s growth and success, we’ve been looking for you!

Our Core Values

· Respect is the bedrock of strong relationships. We respect our co-workers, our partners, our customers, even our competitors - as well as their ideas, their needs, their time, and their talents.

· Humility allows us to recognize our mistakes and value others. When we check our egos at the door, we grow together as individuals and as a team.

· Innovation is the fuel that drives us forward. We welcome, adapt to, and embrace change even when we must move quickly, because we trust the process.

· Positivity carries us through everything we do and every interaction we have. Optimism and a can-do attitude fuel our enthusiasm and passion.

· Empowerment is essential to our culture, as it fosters innovation, personal growth and job satisfaction. We encourage our team to think independently, use their own judgment, make decisions with confidence, and take ownership of their work.

Why Join Synergy Pet Group?

We're growing quickly — with real revenue, real customers, and real technical opportunities. You’ll own technology end-to-end across two related businesses and help build something lasting with a leadership team that values urgency, clarity, and candor. This is your opportunity to define how we build, ship, and scale — and to shape the culture and systems that will power our next chapter.

jobs.title: Head of Veterinary Marketing
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Synergy Pet Group is a recognized leader in the pet industry, known for delivering innovative, high-quality products that enhance the lives of pets and their owners. With consistent growth and a strong market presence, we take pride in our commitment to customer satisfaction and making an impact that matters.

Head of Veterinary Marketing

We are seeking a strategic and people-focused Head of Veterinary Marketing to help build a high-performance team and foster a culture of growth and support. If you’re a marketing professional who thrives in a dynamic, growth-oriented environment and wants to make a real impact, we’d love to hear from you.

Our Values

  1. Respect - Value our peers, partners, customers, and even our competitors. Respect their ideas, their needs, and their time

  2. Humility - Be humble. Humility allows us to grow as a team and as individuals.

  3. Positivity - Embrace optimism and a can-do attitude. Optimism fuels enthusiasm and passion. Everything is figureoutable.

  4. Empowerment - Take ownership. Think independently. Exercise sound judgement and make decisions with confidence. Own your role.

  5. Evolve and Innovate - The world is always changing - evolve with it. Change is your opportunity to get better. Innovate and move forward -- its how we succeed.

Position Summary

The Head of Veterinary Marketing is the strategic lead responsible for growing engagement and adoption across Synergy Pet Group’s veterinary-facing brands. This role requires expertise in SaaS GTM strategies, an obsession with funnel performance, and a passion for the veterinary community.

You'll drive the strategy and execution of marketing programs that add pipeline, increase velocity, and mitigate churn. You’ll own positioning, market insight, product marketing, and churn reduction initiatives. You’ll partner closely with product, sales, and customer success to bring ideas to market and refine strategies. Your key priorities will be driving pipeline, accelerating conversion, and reducing churn across SPG’s veterinary brands: Shepherd, Pet Assure, and DVM Galaxy.

This role reports to the VP of Marketing.

Key Responsibilities

  • Develop deep audience insight into veterinary professionals to inform messaging, positioning, and segmentation strategies that support message-market fit.

  • Own go-to-market strategy and lead cross-functional launches that accelerate adoption and reduce churn across SPG’s veterinary platforms.

  • Run full-funnel campaigns and always-on programs that drive acquisition, engagement, and retention.

  • Own the marketing roadmap for the veterinary vertical, prioritizing high-impact work that aligns with growth goals.

  • Ensure consistency in brand and messaging across all channels and customer touchpoints.

  • Track performance and optimize strategy in collaboration with Sales, Product, and Customer Care, balancing strategic leadership with hands-on execution.

Key Metrics for Success

  • Veterinary Engagement & Activation – Growth in platform adoption, usage, and account activation across Shepherd and Pet Assure.

  • Lifecycle Performance – Improvements in funnel conversion rates from acquisition through retention, including onboarding, feature adoption, and upsell.

Qualifications

  • Team Player Mentality: Demonstrate a commitment to supporting and uplifting others on the team, ensuring collective success over individual wins.

  • Solution-Oriented: Focuses on problem-solving and proactively finding ways to overcome challenges.

  • 5+ years of SaaS marketing experience, including audience ownership and product marketing for technology-driven products.

  • Strong understanding of SaaS GTM mechanics and buyer journeys.

  • Passion for the veterinary industry and helping veterinary professionals thrive.

Why Join Synergy Pet Group?

We're growing quickly — with real revenue, real customers, and real technical opportunities. You’ll own technology end-to-end across two related businesses and help build something lasting with a leadership team that values urgency, clarity, and candor. This is your opportunity to define how we build, ship, and scale — and to shape the culture and systems that will power our next chapter.

jobs.title: PA Program Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Synergy Pet Group is a recognized leader in the pet industry, known for delivering innovative, high-quality products that enhance the lives of pets and their owners. With consistent growth and a strong market presence, we take pride in our commitment to customer satisfaction and making an impact that matters.

Pet Assure Veterinary Network Program Manager

Position Summary

The Pet Assure Veterinary Network Program Manager will lead the strategy and execution of two key veterinary-facing brands within Synergy Pet Group: Pet Assure and DVM Galaxy.

This role is both strategic and hands-on, responsible for defining and executing the growth strategy for the Pet Assure veterinary network, including identifying priority markets, partnership opportunities, and retention levers, as well as leading the go-to-market (GTM) strategy, operations, and veterinary engagement.

Pet Assure is the largest veterinary network in the U.S., offering discounted pet healthcare services to pet owners. DVM Galaxy, a website-building service for veterinarians, is a flagship perk for network members. With further enhancement, DVM Galaxy is positioned to drive top-of-funnel growth for the Pet Assure network.

This role reports to the Synergy’s COO.

Key Responsibilities

Embrace and live Synergy Pet Group’s core values - respect, humility, and positivity - in all partner interactions and internal collaboration, recognizing that these principles are foundational to both our past achievements and future success.

This role works cross-functionally with Marketing, Sales, and Product and will manage a small team of network developers.

· Develop and refine long-term strategies to position the Pet Assure Network as the preferred choice among U.S. veterinarians.

· Build and manage programs to recruit new veterinary practices into the Pet Assure Network, using a mix of marketing, direct outreach, partnerships, and inbound interest. Assist with lead generation, audience segmentation, and performance tracking.

· Refine and scale onboarding processes for both Pet Assure and DVM Galaxy new practices to ensure a smooth, consistent, and brand-aligned experience.

· Provide ongoing support to both Pet Assure and DVM Galaxy veterinary practices, ensuring satisfaction with the program, resolving issues promptly, and identifying opportunities for increased engagement and retention.

· Collaborate with and enable the Shepherd sales team with their Pet Assure outreach, including updated messaging, competitive insights, and training needed to effectively communicate the value of the Pet Assure Veterinary Network.

· Collaborate with internal teams and the Shepherd Veterinary Network team to align network growth efforts with broader company initiatives and member needs.

· Create tracking and reporting frameworks to measure program performance, identify growth opportunities, and drive continual improvement.

· Build relationships with vet practices to understand their needs and refine the value proposition of the Pet Assure program.

· Act as a voice of network veterinarians - share insights internally to inform marketing, service offerings, and operational improvements.

Key Metrics for Success

· New Practice Onboarding: Number of veterinary practices onboarded per quarter to the Pet Assure network, including both direct sign-ups and those sourced via Shepherd.

· Practice Acquisition Cost: Average cost to acquire a new Pet Assure partner practice.

· Practice Retention Cost: Average cost to retain a practice.

· Practice Retention Rate: Percentage of practices retained quarter-over-quarter and year-over-year.

· Member Complaint Resolution Rate: Percentage of member complaints resolved successfully.

· Support Response Time: Average time to first response and full resolution for veterinary support inquiries.

· DVM Galaxy Adoption: Number of new DVM Galaxy websites launched with veterinary partners.

· Innovation & Process Improvements: Number of new initiatives or process enhancements implemented, with associated impact metrics (e.g., efficiency gains, satisfaction improvements, revenue contribution).

Qualifications

· 3–5 years of experience in program management, partnerships, or business development, ideally within healthcare, veterinary, insurance, or SaaS

· Proven success in growing and managing external partner networks or B2B relationships

· Excellent organizational and project management skills — ability to manage multiple initiatives at once

· Data-driven mindset with comfort using CRM tools and reporting dashboards (e.g., HubSpot, Salesforce, Excel)

· Passion for animals and/or veterinary care a plus

Why Join Synergy Pet Group?

We're growing quickly — with real revenue, real customers, and real technical opportunities. You’ll own technology end-to-end across two related businesses and help build something lasting with a leadership team that values urgency, clarity, and candor. This is your opportunity to define how we build, ship, and scale — and to shape the culture and systems that will power our next chapter.
